author: Bindu Shajan Perappadan
text:
Office bearers of medical societies and doctors across the country have urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to implement the new Pictorial Warnings on tobacco products from April 1.

Cutting across specialties, 653 doctors have written to Mr. Modi requesting him to prevent the powerful tobacco lobby from subverting the government’s anti-tobacco measures.

“Medical evidence has proven beyond doubt that tobacco is the only consumer product that has no good use except causing disease, disability and death. We are very hopeful that he will do the best for the health of the nation,” Dr. Pankaj Chaturvedi, professor and surgeon at Tata Memorial Hospital said. Copies of the letters have also been sent to Health Minister J. P. Nadda.
title: Enforce pictorial warnings on tobacco: doctors
